column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////We got the original Lou's (roma tomatoes
column5: and the Malnati Chicago classic (sausage). The crust was pretty good
column6: with a bit of a tart
column8: which complemented the rich toppings. Both were very good
column9: and left all of us stuffed
column10: with a few slices to spare. We ordered two mediums for 6 people
column11: and the stuffed spinach bread as an appetizer
column12: which was more than enough food. Service was a little spotty
column13: but not enough to be a problem. The prices are actually pretty good
column15: as each of us only paid around $18
